reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is early access, but at the moment there is very little to do.  All levels + boss beaten in 20 minutes.  I would happily change my review if a lot more content was added. (The rest of my recorded playtime was spent idling for the cards.)

On the plus side, the dev is responsive to feedback, friendly, and appears to be working on fleshing out a lot more levels.  I'm looking forward to more levels and changing this review because the gameplay itself is enjoyable.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Magma Chamber has a good base on it and is entertaining.

The only issue with it is the fact that I beat the entire game in 3 minutes, so there's no way I could pay $5.00 for this.
I actually had to launch the game idle for a few more minutes just to get enough time on my account to be allowed to post a review.

It has good potential, but the current levels were pretty straight forward and I felt like I was only just getting out of what would be the tutorial chapter" of levels. As long as the game is updated with more levels to play
date: then it's all good.\n\nThe boss fight was also fun
recommended: hopefully there will be more of those in the future as well.\n"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's not a bad game, not at all. The reason for not recommending this is that it costs €5 for mere 5 minutes of gameplay. The game was simply released (even if in Early Access) too early.

Early Access Review

Doesn't Fail to Entertain
The game is simple enough; Fun, with challenging levels. I went in with not many expectations but soon enough, I was hooked. The difficulty of levels and creativity adds to my experience, and after all, who would love A puzzle-based action game about a slime escaping a lab inside of a volcano"."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An amazing game with an amazing developer. A must buy in my eyes.
I've been observing this game for a while in greenlight and just couldn't wait for it to be released or at least made early access. As soon as the game came to EA I bought it and I can say that I was quite impressed.

Magma Chamber, as simple as the concept is, can be really entertaining for being a puzzle game. The game gets difficult as you progress, soon introducing boss's that challenge gameplay even further. For an early access game at an early stage Magma Chamber doesn't cease to impress. Can't wait for the developer to update the game with more levels and worlds.

I suggest you give Magma Chamber a try, even if your not into puzzle games. You won't regret it. ;)

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Magma chamber is a fun little puzzle game with a lot of potential.
I recieved the key for free from the developers themselves and I had a blast playing it, even though it was pretty short.
I can see a lot of great things happening with this game in the future and I'm very excited to see where it goes.
Something I could see is Steam Workshop support so player can build their own levels and share it with other users.
I highly recommend this game.

Really good game. I can't wait until the full game is here 7.5/10

Product received for free

Early Access Review

If you liked the Red Puffle from Club Penguin where you melted the ice tiles, you're going to like this.  If you're like me and half your childhood was spent as a slave to Club Penguin, you will be rocking this game in no time.

In all seriousness, it's a really fun game, really well developed so far, and I can't wait to play more levels.  As the levels went on, they got more challenging (something that I am thankful for).

My only complaint thus far is that the sounds are unbalanced, so make sure you prepare your ears for loud explosions and quieter music.

Early Access Review

Magma Chamber is—so far—a relatively short puzzle game akin to Chip's Challenge or similar top-down, tile-based puzzle games (with some levels containing a lot of action!).

It's a really great game, and only a little over 10MB as of this review! I need more levels! more!
